newsitem.title: USA: Kmart chief gets $2.7 million in salary, bonus.
newsitem.headline: Kmart chief gets $2.7 million in salary, bonus.

text.p: Kmart Corp. paid its chairman and chief executive, Floyd Hall, nearly $2.7 million in salary and bonus for 1996, the company's proxy statement filed Monday with the Securities and Exchange Commission showed.

Hall received a 1996 salary of $1 million and a bonus of $1.749 million. He also received 140,000 restricted common shares worth $1.488 million and $144,542 in other compensation including housing and living expenses, the company said.

Kmart said $874,750 of Hall's 1996 cash bonus was used to purchase restricted shares of common stock at a 20 percent discount under the Troy, Mich.-based retailer's management stock purchase plan. The value of the stock was $1.09 million.

Hall's 1996 compensation compares with a salary of $660,300 in 1995, a $1 million bonus, options to purchase 3.45 million shares and restricted share awards worth $6.375 million. Hall used all of his 1995 cash bonus to purchase restricted shares, according to the SEC filing.
Kmart's stock rose 12.5 cents to $12.375 on the New York Stock Exchange in late trading.
